api_list.name: send_mail
api_list.description:
The /send_mail endpoint allows you to send emails programmatically by making a POST request to the API. It provides a convenient way to automate email sending from your applications, services, or systems. Request Format: Send a POST request to /send_mail with a JSON payload containing the following fields: sender_email_id: The email address id of the sender. receiver_email: The email address of the recipient. text: The plain text content of the email. html: The HTML content of the email. subject: The subject of the email. sender email IDs: 1 = "no-reply@emailsend.eu.org" more coming in the future Response: Upon receiving a valid request, the API will accept the email request and initiate the email sending process using the provided information. The response will indicate that the email request has been accepted. Note: It is important to ensure that all required fields are included in the request payload. The API will use the provided sender's email address, recipient's email address, email content (both plain text and HTML), and the subject to send the email. Example Request: POST /send_mail Content-Type: application/json { "sender_email": "1", "receiver_email": "receiver@example.com", "text": "Hello, this is the plain text content of the email.", "html": "Hello

This is the HTML content of the email.

", "subject": "Example Email" } Please ensure that you have the necessary permissions and valid credentials to send emails before using this endpoint.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://emailsendapi-send-emails-with-custom-domains.p.rapidapi.com/send_mail"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "emailsendapi-send-emails-with-custom-domains.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
